channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TrOMR:Transformer-Based Polyphonic Optical Music Recognition
item.description: Optical Music Recognition (OMR) is an important technology in music and has been researched for a long time.

item.title: Boosting Few-shot Action Recognition with Graph-guided Hybrid Matching
item.description: Class prototype construction and matching are core aspects of few-shot action recognition.

item.title: Rethinking Image Forgery Detection via Contrastive Learning and Unsupervised Clustering
item.description: To resolve this dilemma, we propose the FOrensic ContrAstive cLustering (FOCAL) method, a novel, simple yet very effective paradigm based on contrastive learning and unsupervised clustering for the image forgery detection.

item.title: Graph-based Alignment and Uniformity for Recommendation
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel approach, graph-based alignment and uniformity (GraphAU), that explicitly considers high-order connectivities in the user-item bipartite graph.

item.title: MonoNeRD: NeRF-like Representations for Monocular 3D Object Detection
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this work is the first to introduce volume rendering for M3D, and demonstrates the potential of implicit reconstruction for image-based 3D perception.

item.title: Vision Relation Transformer for Unbiased Scene Graph Generation
item.description: Recent years have seen a growing interest in Scene Graph Generation (SGG), a comprehensive visual scene understanding task that aims to predict entity relationships using a relation encoder-decoder pipeline stacked on top of an object encoder-decoder backbone.

item.title: Single Frame Semantic Segmentation Using Multi-Modal Spherical Images
item.description: In recent years, the research community has shown a lot of interest to panoramic images that offer a 360-degree directional perspective.

item.title: GiGaMAE: Generalizable Graph Masked Autoencoder via Collaborative Latent Space Reconstruction
item.description: By considering embeddings encompassing graph topology and attribute information as reconstruction targets, our model could capture more generalized and comprehensive knowledge.

item.title: Inferior Alveolar Nerve Segmentation in CBCT images using Connectivity-Based Selective Re-training
item.description: Inferior Alveolar Nerve (IAN) canal detection in CBCT is an important step in many dental and maxillofacial surgery applications to prevent irreversible damage to the nerve during the procedure. The ToothFairy2023 Challenge aims to establish a 3D maxillofacial dataset consisting of all sparse labels and partial dense labels, and improve the ability of automatic IAN segmentation.

item.title: RLIPv2: Fast Scaling of Relational Language-Image Pre-training
item.description: In this paper, we propose RLIPv2, a fast converging model that enables the scaling of relational pre-training to large-scale pseudo-labelled scene graph data.

item.title: NAPA-VQ: Neighborhood Aware Prototype Augmentation with Vector Quantization for Continual Learning
item.description: However, due to the lack of old data, NECIL methods struggle to discriminate between old and new classes causing their feature representations to overlap.

item.title: MUSE: Music Recommender System with Shuffle Play Recommendation Enhancement
item.description: Recommender systems have become indispensable in music streaming services, enhancing user experiences by personalizing playlists and facilitating the serendipitous discovery of new music.

item.title: Predictive Authoring for Brazilian Portuguese Augmentative and Alternative Communication
item.description: We tested different approaches to representing a pictogram for prediction: as a word (using pictogram captions), as a concept (using a dictionary definition), and as a set of synonyms (using related terms).

item.title: Training with Product Digital Twins for AutoRetail Checkout
item.description: Because the digital twins individually mimic user bias, the resulting DT training set better reflects the characteristics of the target scenario and allows us to train more effective product detection and tracking models.

item.title: ReCon: Reducing Congestion in Job Recommendation using Optimal Transport
item.description: Recommenders are increasingly used in domains where items have limited availability, such as the job market, where congestion is especially problematic: Recommending a vacancy -- for which typically only one person will be hired -- to a large number of job seekers may lead to frustration for job seekers, as they may be applying for jobs where they are not hired.

item.title: DReg-NeRF: Deep Registration for Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: Although Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) is popular in the computer vision community recently, registering multiple NeRFs has yet to gain much attention.

item.title: Denoising diffusion-based MR to CT image translation enables whole spine vertebral segmentation in 2D and 3D without manual annotations
item.description: The 3D translation outperformed the 2D approach, resulting in improved Dice scores (0. 80) and anatomically accurate segmentations in a higher resolution than the original MR image.

item.title: Revisiting Skin Tone Fairness in Dermatological Lesion Classification
item.description: Addressing fairness in lesion classification from dermatological images is crucial due to variations in how skin diseases manifest across skin tones.

item.title: ASAG: Building Strong One-Decoder-Layer Sparse Detectors via Adaptive Sparse Anchor Generation
item.description: We find that the architecture discrepancy between dense and sparse detectors leads to feature conflict, hampering the performance of one-decoder-layer detectors.

item.title: Scope is all you need: Transforming LLMs for HPC Code
item.description: With easier access to powerful compute resources, there is a growing trend in the field of AI for software development to develop larger and larger language models (LLMs) to address a variety of programming tasks.

item.title: Red-Teaming Large Language Models using Chain of Utterances for Safety-Alignment
item.description: In this work, we propose a new safety evaluation benchmark RED-EVAL that carries out red-teaming.

item.title: Masked Spatio-Temporal Structure Prediction for Self-supervised Learning on Point Cloud Videos
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Masked Spatio-Temporal Structure Prediction (MaST-Pre) method to capture the structure of point cloud videos without human annotations.

item.title: Retro-FPN: Retrospective Feature Pyramid Network for Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this way, the categorization of each point is conditioned on its local semantic pattern.

item.title: A hybrid Decoder-DeepONet operator regression framework for unaligned observation data
item.description: Results illustrate the advantages of Decoder-DeepONet and Multi-Decoder-DeepONet in handling unaligned observation data and showcase their potentials in improving prediction accuracy.

item.title: DMCVR: Morphology-Guided Diffusion Model for 3D Cardiac Volume Reconstruction
item.description: However, current cardiac MRI-based reconstruction technology used in clinical settings is 2D with limited through-plane resolution, resulting in low-quality reconstructed cardiac volumes.

item.title: Meta-learning enhanced next POI recommendation by leveraging check-ins from auxiliary cities
item.description: Particularly, a city-level correlation strategy is devised to attentively capture common patterns among cities, so as to transfer more relevant knowledge from more correlated cities.

item.title: Audiovisual Moments in Time: A Large-Scale Annotated Dataset of Audiovisual Actions
item.description: We also offer 2 sets of pre-computed audiovisual feature embeddings, using VGGish/YamNet for audio data and VGG16/EfficientNetB0 for visual data, thereby lowering the barrier to entry for audiovisual DNN research.

item.title: Progression-Guided Temporal Action Detection in Videos
item.description: The framework locates actions in videos by detecting the action evolution process.

item.title: StableVideo: Text-driven Consistency-aware Diffusion Video Editing
item.description: In this paper, we tackle this problem by introducing temporal dependency to existing text-driven diffusion models, which allows them to generate consistent appearance for the edited objects.

item.title: Poison Dart Frog: A Clean-Label Attack with Low Poisoning Rate and High Attack Success Rate in the Absence of Training Data
item.description: Poison Dart Frog does not require access to any training data; it only necessitates knowledge of the target class for the attack, such as 'frog'.

item.title: Spatial LibriSpeech: An Augmented Dataset for Spatial Audio Learning
item.description: We present Spatial LibriSpeech, a spatial audio dataset with over 650 hours of 19-channel audio, first-order ambisonics, and optional distractor noise.

item.title: Small Object Detection via Coarse-to-fine Proposal Generation and Imitation Learning
item.description: The past few years have witnessed the immense success of object detection, while current excellent detectors struggle on tackling size-limited instances.

item.title: Learning in Cooperative Multiagent Systems Using Cognitive and Machine Models
item.description: Developing effective Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) is critical for many applications requiring collaboration and coordination with humans.

item.title: Robust Audio Anti-Spoofing with Fusion-Reconstruction Learning on Multi-Order Spectrograms
item.description: Robust audio anti-spoofing has been increasingly challenging due to the recent advancements on deepfake techniques.

item.title: WizardMath: Empowering Mathematical Reasoning for Large Language Models via Reinforced Evol-Instruct
item.description: Through extensive experiments on two mathematical reasoning benchmarks, namely GSM8k and MATH, we reveal the extraordinary capabilities of our model.

item.title: Decoupled conditional contrastive learning with variable metadata for prostate lesion detection
item.description: Early diagnosis of prostate cancer is crucial for efficient treatment.

item.title: PoSynDA: Multi-Hypothesis Pose Synthesis Domain Adaptation for Robust 3D Human Pose Estimation
item.description: The current 3D human pose estimators face challenges in adapting to new datasets due to the scarcity of 2D-3D pose pairs in target domain training sets.

item.title: Graph of Thoughts: Solving Elaborate Problems with Large Language Models
item.description: We introduce Graph of Thoughts (GoT): a framework that advances prompting capabilities in large language models (LLMs) beyond those offered by paradigms such as Chain-ofThought or Tree of Thoughts (ToT).

item.title: Transitivity-Preserving Graph Representation Learning for Bridging Local Connectivity and Role-based Similarity
item.description: In this paper, we propose Unified Graph Transformer Networks (UGT) that effectively integrate local and global structural information into fixed-length vector representations.

item.title: A Lightweight Transformer for Faster and Robust EBSD Data Collection
item.description: Three dimensional electron back-scattered diffraction (EBSD) microscopy is a critical tool in many applications in materials science, yet its data quality can fluctuate greatly during the arduous collection process, particularly via serial-sectioning.

item.title: Image Processing and Machine Learning for Hyperspectral Unmixing: An Overview and the HySUPP Python Package
item.description: Additionally, we draw a critical comparison between advanced and conventional techniques from the three categories.

item.title: Towards Attack-tolerant Federated Learning via Critical Parameter Analysis
item.description: Federated learning is used to train a shared model in a decentralized way without clients sharing private data with each other.

item.title: ChatHaruhi: Reviving Anime Character in Reality via Large Language Model
item.description: Role-playing chatbots built on large language models have drawn interest, but better techniques are needed to enable mimicking specific fictional characters.

item.title: Self-Calibrated Cross Attention Network for Few-Shot Segmentation
item.description: Moreover, when calculating SCCA, we design a scaled-cosine mechanism to better utilize the support features for similarity calculation.

item.title: Generalizable Decision Boundaries: Dualistic Meta-Learning for Open Set Domain Generalization
item.description: Domain generalization (DG) is proposed to deal with the issue of domain shift, which occurs when statistical differences exist between source and target domains.

item.title: On the Effectiveness of LayerNorm Tuning for Continual Learning in Vision Transformers
item.description: State-of-the-art rehearsal-free continual learning methods exploit the peculiarities of Vision Transformers to learn task-specific prompts, drastically reducing catastrophic forgetting.

item.title: Online Class Incremental Learning on Stochastic Blurry Task Boundary via Mask and Visual Prompt Tuning
item.description: In addition, to alleviate the class imbalance problem, we introduce a new gradient similarity-based focal loss and adaptive feature scaling to ease overfitting to the major classes and underfitting to the minor classes.

item.title: biquality-learn: a Python library for Biquality Learning
item.description: That is why Biquality Learning has been proposed as a machine learning framework to design algorithms capable of handling multiple weaknesses of supervision and dataset shifts without assumptions on their nature and level by relying on the availability of a small trusted dataset composed of cleanly labeled and representative samples.

item.title: Robust Uncertainty Quantification using Conformalised Monte Carlo Prediction
item.description: Deploying deep learning models in safety-critical applications remains a very challenging task, mandating the provision of assurances for the dependable operation of these models.

item.title: Language-guided Human Motion Synthesis with Atomic Actions
item.description: In this paper, we propose ATOM (ATomic mOtion Modeling) to mitigate this problem, by decomposing actions into atomic actions, and employing a curriculum learning strategy to learn atomic action composition.
